sentences.english: On the tenth day after jack came back, an uninvited lady came to my home.
sentences.chinese: 安傑回家的第十天，家裏來了一爲不速之客。

sentences.english: Unbidden guests are often welcomest when they are gone.
sentences.chinese: 不速之客往往是在告辭時最受歡迎。

sentences.english: It was he, the intruder, who interrogated.
sentences.chinese: 他是不速之客，反而盤問個不停。

sentences.english: Edgar sprang to his unbidden guest, blanched with astonishment and rage.
sentences.chinese: 埃德加衝向這位不速之客，臉色因驚愕與憤怒而發白。

sentences.english: You see, for every party, there are bound to be party crashers .
sentences.chinese: 你看，每黨有黨必將受到不速之客。

sentences.english: She felt like an intruder in our house.
sentences.chinese: 她在我家感覺像個不速之客。

sentences.english: He's really a thick - skinned gate-crasher.
sentences.chinese: 他真是個厚臉皮的不速之客。

sentences.english: You think, oh, it’ll only go after the stranger or the intruder.
sentences.chinese: 你以爲，哦，它只會咬陌生人或不速之客。

sentences.english: for she knew the stranger by his horny coat.
sentences.chinese: 她通過不速之客突出的外衣知道了他的身份。

sentences.english: The old trapper’s hut beneath Singing Mountain bears the scars of an unwelcome visitor.
sentences.chinese: 在辛寧山腳下的狩獵人小屋被不速之客弄得傷痕累累。

sentences.english: The intruder,it turned out,was no other than a squirrel.
sentences.chinese: 不速之客原來是一隻小松鼠。

sentences.english: These are known as the wedding crashers .
sentences.chinese: 這些被稱爲婚禮不速之客。
然後有一位潛行的不速之客來訪了。

sentences.english: The flu is one of winter's unwelcomed guess.
sentences.chinese: 流感是冬天的不速之客之一。

sentences.english: The dollars all waited person and youths to all discover wild goose south to fly this visitor who comes uninvited.
sentences.chinese: 元都等人和少年都發現了雁南飛這個不速之客。

sentences.english: Guests who arrive unexpectedly usually have their own agenda.
sentences.chinese: 不速之客通常有他們自己的議程。

definition: to turn up without being invited/unsolicited
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to stick one's head out and look around (idiom)
to send punitive forces against/(fig.) to criticize violently
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
we are honored by your presence
